      Before OAKES and VAN GRAAFEILAND, Circuit Judges, and MISHLER, District Judge.*
      PER CURIAM:
    
    
      1
      This is an appeal from a decision of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, Broderick, J., dismissing appellant's derivative action for failure to comply with Rule 23.1, Fed.R.Civ.P.  On June 8, 1976 Dorothy Elfenbein, a shareholder of Bulova Watch Co., Inc.  ("Bulova"), instituted a derivative action against Bulova, Gulf & Western Industries ("Gulf"), Stelux Manufacturing Co.  ("Stelux"), and the directors of Bulova.  The complaint alleged that prior to May, 1976 Gulf owned approximately 27% Of the then outstanding common stock of Bulova.
